snippet: MANDEL--Kenneth, 76, of Briarcliff Manor, NY, passed away January 26, 2016 after a courageous battle with cancer. Ken was a loving husband to his wife of 52 years, Carole Leshne Mandel, and a devoted father to his daughters Wendy, Laura, and Jodi, and their spouses Yale, Jeff, and Kenny. He loved and adored his eight grandchildren, Josh, Arielle, Taylor, Jordan, Ethan, Emma, Matthew, and Maya. He is also survived by his mother, Olga, to whom he was a devoted son, and by his brother, Richard. He graduated from New Rochelle High School and went on to study at Cornell University and New York University. Ken held an array of sales positions that showcased his people skills, intellect and wit, culminating in the successful leadership of Mandel Investments until his retirement in 2013. He loved fishing and boating with his grandchildren, playing golf, spending time with his friends, and getting to know people. His greatest love was his family, especially spending family vacations at the Jersey Shore and Hamptons. Ken had a wonderful sense of humor, a gift for storytelling, and he left a lasting impression on those he met. He will be greatly missed. 1/3
